result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Enos Gillman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Enos Gillman Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Enos Gillman Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Richard Enos Gillman appeared.  Court called.  Set for Court Trial.  There is an agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to a misdemeanor - 961.41(3g)(b) (Possession of a Controlled Subtance)  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Court costs of $243.00 and $200 for the DNA surcharge
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- 20 days to appeal
Court trial on August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Richard Enos Gillman appeared.  Court called at 3:33 p.m.  Attorney Andrea advises there is not an agreement.  Set out for trial. Attorney Andrea will stipulate to the lab results and the analyst does not need to testify.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:36 p.m. lw  Court trial scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Court called at 4:03 p.m.  DE has received a copy of the Information and has reviewed it.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty. CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Richard Enos Gillman appeared.  Court called at 10:00 a.m.  Set for preliminary hearing.  S/T of Officer David Pohlman of the Roberts Police Department.  Direct by ADA Minser.  Cross by Attorney Andrea.  Witness excused.  No argument by the attorneys.  Court finds probable cause that a fe and binds the DE over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
John Hancock ck# 025397 sent this date. eif
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
John Hancock 15R 018428. eif
Preliminary hearing at 01-13-2016 10:00 am

Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  A.B.R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
